alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 28 at 1:48PM PDT until further notice by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Snow melt and reservoir releases will cause the river flows to remain high. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. An increase in snowmelt is expected into the weekend, resulting in colder and higher flows. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands, pasture, farmland and some rural roads in Mason Valley. There may be some minor flooding of yards and basements in Mason. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:20 PM PDT Wednesday the stage was 10.2 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:20 PM PDT Wednesday was 10.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.2 feet this afternoon. It will then rise to 10.4 feet late Sunday evening. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.4 feet on 06/30/1982. - https://www.cnrfc.noaa.gov http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Mason Bridge and Miller Lane are closed. Additional information is available at www.cnrfc.noaa.gov. The next statement will be issued Thursday afternoon.
